page.title: 04LANGUAGE
page.content: We think most people around Cofton school have a broad Birmingham accent and the only slang term regulary used is LOO meaning lavatory or toilet. Only English is spoken in most houses. Most people have lived in Birmingham all of their lives so there are not many accents or dialects in Cofton, Longbridge and West Heath. Quite a lot people speak bad lauguage because they think it sounds big, but it is not allowed in homes. People have different ideas about which words are considered as swearing. We have a variety of sayings like when we ask out parents for money they reply that money does not grow on trees. Also if we ignore each other they say its like speaking to a brick wall if you can't we find something which is not hard to find we are told you are blind as a bat. There are many such phrases.
